Order Book and Financial Performance:

As of April 1, 2025, BEL's total order book stood at around ₹71,650 crore, including an export order book of USD 359 million.

BEL secured orders worth Rs. 18,715 Cr in the fiscal year 2024-25.

BEL received orders worth ₹593.22 Crores on April 2, 2025, for providing maintenance services for the Akash Missile System to the Indian Air Force.

The company concluded negotiations for the acquisition of orders worth ₹5,000 Crores around the same time.

BEL achieved a turnover of around Rs. 23,000 Cr (Provisional & Unaudited) during FY 2024-25, a 16% growth over the previous year.

The company's export sales were around US$ 106 Million during FY 2024-25, a 14% growth.

BEL has delivered good profit growth of 23.8% CAGR over the last 5 years.

BEL's Q4 FY 2025 net profit increased 18% YoY to ₹2,127 crore, while revenue rose 7% to ₹9,150 crore.

For the full financial year 2024-25, BEL's PAT was ₹5,323 crore, and revenue was ₹23,769 crore.

BEL's Q1 FY26 (June 2025 quarter) revenue increased by 46% to ₹133.5 crore YoY, and profit after tax more than doubled to ₹17.6 crore from ₹8.4 crore in Q1 FY25.

Management & Stock Related:

On May 19, 2025, the Board of Directors of BEL recommended a final dividend of Re 0.90 per equity share (90%) of Re 1 each for the financial year 2024-25,according to ET Now.

Brokerages like Nuvama, JM Financial, and ICICI Securities have maintained a "Buy" rating on BEL shares after the Q4 results and raised the target price.

According to The Economic Times, BEL is almost debt-free.

The stock's 52-week low was Rs 401 on April 7, 2025.

Paras Defence and Space Technologies Limited won a contract worth approximately ₹45.32 crore (including taxes) from BEL to supply Signal and Data Processing Systems and Multi-Sensor Fusion Systems for Air Defence Applications.
